review: The Chromecast is the first (of many?) device built on the GoogleCast specification for media transmittal. What Chromecast affords you that other streaming receivers do not is the ability to start a stream on another computing device and then hand it off to the Chromecast. For instance, if you start up Netflix on your iPad then toss it over to the Chromecast, your iPad is NOT streaming the media any more; you're free to do other things on your iPad. This handoff protocol is something that's been missing from streaming and this spec and device can be a real potential game changer. Super easy to use and set up. Big fan.
